intro: Crucianella angustifolia f. desenspicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sea holly, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the Plumbagaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is typically found in coastal or saline environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a unique addition to specialized gardens. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in certain regions.
